paper_abstract: In Baaz and Iemhoff (2006, Annals of Pure and Applied Logic, 142, 269-295), an alternative skolemization method called eskolemization was introduced that is sound and complete for existence logic with respect to existential quantifiers. Existence logic is a conservative extension of intuitionistic logic by an existence predicate. Therefore, eskolemization provides a skolemization method for intuitionistic logic as well. All proofs in Baaz and Iemhoff (2006, Annals of Pure and Applied Logic, 142, 269-295) were semantical. In this article, a proof-theoretic proof of the completeness of eskolemization with respect to existential quantifiers is presented.
